translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions for Phenomena, the Text in Triads

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽7.18. Atītattika🔽Naatītaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naatīto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava.🔽Naatīto dhammo naatītassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naatīto dhammo naanāgatassa🔽dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naatīto dhammo naatītassa ca naanāgatassa ca dhammassa🔽hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  atītattika  na atītam dhammam paṭicca na atītaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe avigate nava  na atītaḥ dhammaḥ na atītassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na atītaḥ dhammaḥ na anāgatassa  dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na atītaḥ dhammaḥ na atītassa ca na anāgatassa ca dhammassa  hetu paccayena paccayaḥ

original: Naanāgato dhammo naanāgatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naanāgato dhammo naatītassa🔽dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naanāgato dhammo naatītassa ca naanāgatassa ca dhammassa🔽hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Naatīto ca naanāgato ca dhammā naatītassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naatīto
analyzed: na anāgataḥ dhammaḥ na anāgatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na anāgataḥ dhammaḥ na atītassa 🔽dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na anāgataḥ dhammaḥ na atītassa ca na anāgatassa ca dhammassa 🔽hetu paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽na atītaḥ ca na anāgataḥ ca dhammā na atītassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na atītaḥ
translated: With respect to the condition being a past phenomenon, the effect being a past phenomenon: There is no condition being a past phenomenon and the effect being a past phenomenon. (In brief.) phenomenon: There are nine. … With respect to the condition being a past phenomenon, the effect being a past or future phenomenon: There are nine. … With respect to the condition being a past original: ca naanāgato ca dhammā naanāgatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naatīto ca naanāgato🔽ca dhammā naatītassa ca naanāgatassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ca na anāgataḥ ca dhammā na anāgatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na atītaḥ ca na anāgataḥ  ca dhammā na atītassa ca na anāgatassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo
translated: Neither-past-nor-future states are a condition, as a condition being a root, for neither-past-nor-future states.🔽(Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa, adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa …pe… nissaye nava, upanissaye aṭṭhārasa, purejāte …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa pe nissaye nava upanissaye aṭṭhārasa purejāte pe avigate nava
translated: Nine in the case of root cause; eighteen in the case of object; eighteen in the case of predominance; … (in detail as in the case of root cause) … nine in the case of dissociation; eighteen in the case of presence; eighteen in the case of non-disappearance; nine in the case of non-restraint.
